title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 7, ch. II, pt. 52 - Inmates, Employees And The Public
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 7, ch. II, pt. 52 - Inmates, Employees And The Public

State Regulations
§ 52.1 to 52.2 - Renumbered
§ 52.3 - Use of employment identification
§ 52.4 - Pecuniary interests by employee prohibited
§ 52.5 - No work for employee to be done in institution
§ 52.6 - Treatment of inmates by employees prohibited
§ 52.7 - Repealed
§ 52.8 - Group interviews of inmates
§ 52.9 - Employees to remain with inmates
§ 52.10 - Courtesy required of visiting room supervisor
§ 52.11 - Search of visiting room
§ 52.12 - Use of lavatories
§ 52.13 - Leaving visiting room
§ 52.14 - Departing inmates to precede employee
§ 52.15 - Inmates not to be passengers on departing conveyances
§ 52.16 - Entrance supervisor to keep records of entering vehicles and contents
§ 52.17 - Search of entering and departing civilians
§ 52.18 - Association with inmates and criminals prohibited
§ 52.19 - Employees may prefer charges
§ 52.20 - Attire of inmates outside institution

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 7, ch. II, pt. 52

Statutory authority: Correction Law, §112

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
